In this example, the main heading identifies the division as a chapter and gives its number, the sub-heading indicates the content of the chapter, and the descriptive heading indicates the manuscript materials represented in the chapter.

<div1 type="chapter" n="VII">
<pb n="277"/>
<head type="main"><smcap>Chapter</smcap> VII</head>
<ornament type="line"/>
<head type="sub"><i>FROM FORT MANDAN TO THE YELLOWSTONE</i></head>
<head type="desc">Clark's Journal, March 22&ndash;April 27, 1805 <lb/>
Lewis's Journal, April 7&ndash;27</head>
<ornament type="line"/>
<div2 type="section">
<head><hi rend="left">[Clark:]</hi></head>
<div3 type="entry">
<head><hi rend="right"><date value="1805-03-23">23 <i>(22 mistake) of March Friday</i> 1805</date></hi></head>
<p>A CLOUDY Day
